alert.note: Alert for Stillwater (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 8:07PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following counties, Carbon and Stillwater. * WHEN...Until 945 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 802 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain fell due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell, with the heaviest rain over and near portions of Beaver Creek, White Bird Creek, and Volney Creek. While the heaviest rain has moved out of the advisory area, minor flooding impacts will continue. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roscoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
